reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Continuation of: Strengthening the Directly Observed Treatment Strategy (DOTS) and Moving towards Universal Access

description.narrative: Mali - Tuberculosis - Catholic Relief Services - United States Conference of Catholic Bishops - CRS Mali. This program has the following goals: Le but du Plan Stratégique National de lutte contre la Tuberculose (2015-2019) est d'atténuer les souffrances et le poids socio-économique engendrés par la tuberculose. The objectives of this program are: Dépister 70% de cas TB toutes formes d’ici 2019 et traiter avec succès 90% des cas de TB (passer de 76 à 90%) d’ici 2019. Dépister 90% des cas TB au VIH et mettre au moins 90% des TB/VIH sous TAR d’ici 2019. Identifier 80 % des cas probables de TB MR et traiter avec succès au moins 75% d’ici 2019. Orienter 15% des TB toutes formes confondus par la communauté d’ici 2019. Renforcer la gestion du programme et la coordination des activités de lutte contre la TB

title.narrative: Coverage / Output indicator for MLI-T-CRS
Percentage of people living with HIV newly enrolled in HIV care started on TB preventive therapy
M&E-other 1: Percentage of testing and treatment centers (TTCs) submitting a complete report to the NTCP within 45 days of the end of the quarter
Percentage of people living with HIV initiated on ART who are screened for TB in HIV treatment settings

Treatment success rate- all forms: Percentage of TB cases, all forms, bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, successfully treated (cured plus treatment completed) among all TB cases registered for treatment during a specified period, new and relapse cases
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
Number of cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB that began second-line treatment
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/high risk groups
Percentage of TB patients who had an HIV test result recorded in the TB register
Percentage of HMIS or other routine reporting units submitting timely reports according to national guidelines
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/ high risk groups (other than prisoners)
Percentage of HIV-positive registered TB patients given anti-retroviral therapy during TB treatment
Percentage of bacteriologically confirmed TB cases successfully treated (cured plus completed treatment) among the bacteriologically confirmed TB cases registered during a specified period
Percentage of notified TB cases, all forms, contributed by non-NTP providers - private/non-governmental facilities
Number of notified cases of bacteriologically confirmed TB, new and relapses
Percentage of registered new and relapse TB patients with documented HIV status
Number of notified cases of all forms of TB (i.e. bacteriologically confirmed + clinically diagnosed), new and relapse cases
Percentage of HIV-positive new and relapse TB patients on ART during TB treatment
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among prisoners
Percentage of HIV-positive patients who were screened for TB in HIV care or treatment settings
Percentage of previously treated TB patients receiving DST (bacteriologically positive cases only)
Impact indicator for MLI-T-CRS
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
RR-TB and/or MDR-TB prevalence among new TB patients: Proportion of new TB cases with RR-TB and/or MDR-TB
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB prevalence rate per 100,000 population
Outcome indicator for MLI-T-CRS
TB O-other1: PTB+ case notification rate New PTB+ cases notified each year per 100,000 people
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
